column5: Well I'm going there for the weekend to Okimot Lodge (Tomiko spelled backwards!). Really looking forward to this trip as I have been doing renos at the house and man I am getting tired of it!  So this lake looks quite promising, and I am hoping for a nice fish fry. I was just wondering what colours, bait or lure types to try out up there. I would suspect the water temp should be good and cold by then and they would head to usual fall structure. If anyone has tips or suggestions it would be greatly appreciated.  Thanks, Rob
Chubs on a jig head. Motor oil twister tails or mustard color but they love chubs in the spring. I have heard from a buddy that goes up every July that worm harnesses work great in the warm weather
Look really quaint from 2500 feet AGL this morning!!
Pm randy he lives right there or TJ
Really Drove by your place probly 5 times this summer,and no one home.   Did you know it was me,and not answer the door? LOL

Well I was doing my reno's for 2 weeks on and then take a break and then 3 weeks on. I was wondering who was shooting at my house! You need to stop by, haven't seen you in a while. Beer is always cold  Pm randy he lives right there or TJ: Will do, and thanks for the tips on the chubs and twister tails Mike!   Rob C
